Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui.gui.utils

Class SceneLoader

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.ui.gui.utils.SceneLoader
public class SceneLoader
extends java.lang.Object
This class is a helper to load the scene while applying various customization effects (such as animations) and executes the steps that initialize the scene and its controller.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void applyBlurIn​(javafx.scene.Parent newOverlay, double duration)
    This method executes the scene loading (as an overlay) by setting the overlay root and starts the blur in animation

    This method executes the blur out
    static void applyFadeIn​(javafx.scene.Scene mainScene, javafx.scene.Parent newRoot, double duration)

    This method executes the fade out and optionally executes the fade in

      Class constructor
      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • executeSceneChange

      public void executeSceneChange()
      The method which starts the scene loading process

    • applySceneFade

      private void applySceneFade​(SavedScene savedScene)
      This method applies fade in and fade out effects to the current scene and loads the new scene
      Parameters:
      savedScene - the new scene to load in

    • loadAndSave

      private SavedScene loadAndSave​(GUI gui)
      This method attempts to load an .fxml file and, if successful saves the corresponding SavedScene for later use
      Parameters:
      gui - the GUI instance
      Returns:
      the SavedScene if the loading was successful, null otherwise

    • loadNewFXML

      public static SavedScene loadNewFXML​(java.lang.String file, ClientState clientState, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle) throws java.io.IOException
      This method loads the FXML from memory, creating a SavedScene containing all the scene elements
      Parameters:
      file - a String representing the path in the resource folder pointing to the .fxml file
      clientState - the State bound to the scene
      resourceBundle - a ResourceBundle to load i18n strings from
      Returns:
      a SavedScene instance containing all the scene components
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the path was invalid

    • loadFromSaved

      public static SavedScene loadFromSaved​(java.lang.String file, GUI gui)
      This method retrieves a previously stored SavedScene
      Parameters:
      file - the .fxml file whose scene we want to load
      gui - the GUI instance
      Returns:
      the SavedScene instance

    • geti18n

      private static java.util.ResourceBundle geti18n()
      This method retrieves the ResourceBundle for the currently set locale
      Returns:
      the ResourceBundle

    • applyFadeIn

      public static void applyFadeIn​(javafx.scene.Scene mainScene, javafx.scene.Parent newRoot, double duration)
      This method executes the real scene loading by setting the root and starts the fade in animation
      Parameters:
      mainScene - the Scene object in which the scene is to be loaded
      newRoot - the Root object to be loaded in the scene
      duration - the fade in duration

    • applyFadeOut

      public static void applyFadeOut​(javafx.scene.Scene mainScene, javafx.scene.Parent newRoot, double fadeOutDuration, double fadeInDuration)
      This method executes the fade out and optionally executes the fade in
      Parameters:
      mainScene - the Scene object in which the animation is to be executed
      newRoot - the root to be loaded in the scene after the fade out
      fadeOutDuration - the fade out duration
      fadeInDuration - the fade in duration

    • applyBlurIn

      public static void applyBlurIn​(javafx.scene.Parent newOverlay, double duration)
      This method executes the scene loading (as an overlay) by setting the overlay root and starts the blur in animation
      Parameters:
      newOverlay - the root to be loaded in the scene
      duration - the blur in duration

    • applyBlurOut

      public static void applyBlurOut​(double duration)
      This method executes the blur out
      Parameters:
      duration - the blur out duration
